to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to keep oneself pure/to preserve one's integrity/to remain chaste

sentences.english: If Shou Shen, vertical pro at nothing, only superficial ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 若不守身，縱能事親，亦只是皮毛儀式而已。

sentences.english: How can young people remain pure? By living according to your word.
sentences.chinese: 青年怎樣才能守身如玉？那就只有遵從你的言語。

sentences.english: I can advise you about sex, but I cannot keep you pure.
sentences.chinese: 我能在性方面給你忠告，但不能讓你守身如玉。
